p.style: font-family: "Cabin Condensed", sans-serif; text-align: center; font-size: 16px;

div.p: Use the YCJUSD Online Enrollment platform to enroll your child for school. Click Here to access Enrollment platform and registration information.

div.h2: Distance Learning Opportunities for Parents and Teachers
div.p: Click here to go to the YCJUSD Distance Learning site. Use the tabs across the top to access Student Work by school and grade level, Parent Resources, and Teacher Resources.

img.alt: Click for Distance Learning work and resources

div.h2: Free Breakfast and Lunch Drive Thru

img.alt: Click for information about free meal program

div.h2: Schools closed for the remainder of the 2019-20 school year

ul.li: Click here for information about school closures and COVID-19
Click here for Flu Prevention Tips

div.p: Click here if you would like to request printed copies of the generic distance learning enrichment packet.
Pick up: Tuesday & Thursday 11:00am-12:30pm

p.i: *NOTE: Request does not apply to YHS & PVMS

img.alt: Click here for printed packet request form

div.h3: Free and Low Cost WiFi for students

p.span: Several internet providers are offering free or low cost hot spots to keep students connected during COVID-19 school closures.

div.h2:
Public Libraries are Closed...
eContent is OPEN!
div.p: Click here to register for a FREE County Library Card.

div.p: 11 days ago
Mar. 2, 2020 - Students Brielle Lara, Atalie Bogh, London Patriquin and Hunter Scullin represent YHS at the annual San Bernardino County Student Advisory Panel.

h1.span: Newsmirror article of the week: YHS Champions highlight cif southern section wrestling at carter high

div.p: Feb. 23, 2020 - Yucaipa High School boys wrestling qualified all 14 varsity wrestlers to compete in the CIF Southern Section Eastern Division Championships this past weekend.

img.alt: Yucaipa High School Champions highlight CIF Southern Section Wrestling at Carter High

span.span: Ca State superintendent applauds the 2020 kindness challenge

h1.span: Newsmirror article of the week: YHS GIRLS BASKETBALL TEAM FIRST IS OFF TO A GREAT START

div.p: Jan. 10, 2020 - Having graduated four seniors after the 2018-19 season taking most of the height on the team with them, the Yucaipa High School girls basketball team needed to take a little different approach this year.

h1.span: Yucaipa-Calimesa’s ‘singing custodian’ calls it a career after 39 years

div.h2: Valley Elementary School gave him an oldies-fueled sendoff Friday morning, Nov. 22.

h1.span: Newsmirror article of the week: YHS cross country teams first in Citrus Belt League Championships

div.p: Nov. 15, 2019 - The Yucaipa High School cross country team took three first-place spots and dominated the Citrus Belt League this season. Both girls and boys Varsity teams will move on to the CIF Prelims on Nov. 15 in Riverside.

h1.span: Newsmirror article of the week: YHS tennis team melds cross-section of students into a successful formula

div.p: Oct 28, 2019 - Among the 2019 version of the 2019 Yucaipa High School tennis team are a mixture of personalities that come from across the nation and across the planet. The formula has worked as the Thunderbirds have a 12-2 record and are 6-1 record thus far in Citrus Belt League and has assured itself of postseason play.
Oct. 2019 -Mesa View's annual robotics scrimmage has grown to 20 teams and over 250 people. Teams come from away as Temecula and Fontana for a great day of fun and competition!

div.h3: YHS ASB Helps to Raise Money in Support of Families Affected by the Sandalwood Fire
div.p: Yucaipa High School Associate Student Body is raising money to present to the Family Promise Adopt a Family program. Support those families affected by the Sandalwood fire by donating online. Click here.

El Cuerpo Estudiantil Asociado de la Preparatoria Yucaipa está recaudando dinero para presentar al programa Family. Apoye a las familias afectadas por el incendio del sándalo donando en línea. Click here.

Congratulations Christine McLaughlin who was celebrated as the 2020 YCJUSD Teacher of the Year at the district "Around the World and Home Again" themed Kick off Event! Christine is currently a 4th-grade teacher at Competitive Edge Charter Academy.

The end of the training occurred on September 26, 2019, for a cohort of administrators participating in the National Institute for School Leadership (NISL) Executive Development Program (EDP). Congratulations to the following YCJUSD administrators who recently completed the EDP: Leslie Burghardt, Frank Tucci, Eric Vreeman, and Jaime Anderson.

span.b: Medical Professionals Visit HBS Academy Students

div.p: Oct. 2, 2019 - 10th and 12th-grade Health and Biomedical Sciences Academy students had medical professionals visit their classes today. 12th-grade students were going through Workplace Wednesday in their ERWC class and having to talk through conflict resolution when one nurse didn’t complete their tasks during the shift. 10th-grade students were working on creating models of muscle contractions. Advisory Board members were able to talk with students about their projects and their scenarios and give feedback and insights.

Sept. 24, 2019 - Parents and students attend the 10th and 11th-grade College Applications Bootcamp workshop presented by Cecilia E. Johnson. This informational workshop covered the aspects of the college application process, including organization, college choice strategies, college and scholarship applications, essays, college admissions offers, and financial aid.

span.span: Senior HBS students receive their white coats

div.p: August 23, 2019 - Senior Health and Biomedical Sciences Academy students received their White Coats from academy teachers on Friday afternoon. These students are currently in their 4th year of the HBS Academy and are learning more about careers in the health care profession in order to make their decisions about their post-secondary plans. Congrats to the HBS Class of 2020!

August 2019 - Students from Ridgeview Elementary participated in the 66ers Hit the Books Reading Program, which is a reading incentive program targeted towards elementary level students. This fun and exciting program highlights the importance of reading, while also showing students reading is fun! Ridgeview Elementary was one of the top three schools that read the most books, taking 3rd place and winning a $1,000 cash prize for their school! Congratulations to the students from Ridgeview who participated.
Use our new communication tools to keep in touch with your child's school, activities and important information.

figcaption.p: School and informational e-flyers delivered right to your computer or mobile device.

p.a: Click here to learn more about Peachjar.

figcaption.p: Access school information, Aeries Portal, lunch menus, and more. "Follow" your child's school and receive important notifications.
Visit your App Store, or Google Play and search for: YCJUSD

span.data-emptytext: Yucaipa-Calimesa Joint Unified School District provides equal opportunity in its programs, activities, and employment
span.data-value:
Contact us at: contact_us@ycjusd.us

The Governing Board desires to provide a safe school environment that allows all students equal access and opportunities in the district's academic and other educational support programs, services, and activities. The Board prohibits, at any district school or school activity, unlawful discrimination, harassment, intimidation, and bullying of any student based on the student's actual race, color, ancestry, national origin, ethnic group identification, age, religion, marital or parental status, physical or mental disability, sex, sexual orientation, gender, gender identity, or gender expression; the perception of one or more of such characteristics; or association with a person or group with one or more of these actual or perceived characteristics.

This website is regularly reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. Any website accessibility concerns or suggestions may be brought to the attention of ​Mark Pierson at ​mark_pierson@ycjusd.us

p.span:
Contact us at: contact_us@ycjusd.us
The Governing Board desires to provide a safe school environment that allows all students equal access and opportunities in the district's academic and other educational support programs, services, and activities. This website is regularly reviewed and updated to ensure compliance with Section 504 of the Rehabilitation Act and Title II of the Americans with Disabilities Act. Any website accessibility concerns or suggestions may be brought to the attention of ​Mark Pierson at ​mark_pierson@ycjusd.us

p.a: Website Hosting Solution Powered by SchoolBlocks

div.h3:
Welcome to the SchoolBlocks
self-guided tour!
div.p: The most common question we receive is, how is SchoolBlocks inspired by Pinterest? SchoolBlocks eliminates navigation bars and uses a block style layout that’s similar to Pinterest. It creates a unique and engaging browsing experience, optimizes for mobile and removes a lot of navigational complexity.
Please click on the red plus signs found on this page to learn more about specific features.
As an administrator, you will have the custom page editing tools auto-load. Just click ‘read more’ to access our advanced page editing tools.
This bar holds all content types. Click on the Admin button, click "add block", select a content type, add your content then insert the block into the page.
This icon appears when you have edit permissions. Hold your mouse down and move the block. You’ll see the page reorganize!
Each block type has a custom editing experience. Click the pencil on any block or view our help documentation to learn more about block types.
